name: Monthly Retro: June 2025 - Foundations and Momentum
premise: The JedAI Council convenes for their monthly retrospective to assess June's transformative developments in ElizaOS, from major architectural changes to community growth, and chart the strategic course ahead.
summary: June 2025 marked a pivotal month for ElizaOS with foundational architecture improvements, the stealth launch of v2, and growing community momentum around agent tokens. The council debates balancing technical excellence with market timing while addressing critical ecosystem gaps.

key_developments.summary: Major refactoring with server separation, agent-scoped plugins, and messaging system overhaul
Added support for Google Generative AI, Ollama, and OpenRouter expanding model flexibility
CLI modernization, testing framework unification, and API client improvements
ELI5 and agent token economy gaining traction with significant community interest
Twitter plugin instability and auto.fun underutilization becoming critical blockers

recurring_themes.council_take: Tension between technical readiness and market timing - we have the tech but ecosystem isn't stable
Clear consensus this is underutilized but no clear ownership or execution plan
Community excitement around ELI5/agent tokens but utility and tokenomics remain unclear

wins: Successfully shipped ElizaOS v2 with major architectural improvements
Unified testing framework reducing CI/CD complexity
Strong community engagement around agent tokens
Expanded AI provider support improving flexibility
CLI modernization significantly improving developer onboarding
challenges: Twitter plugin instability blocking v2 public announcement
Auto.fun platform remains underutilized despite strategic importance
Plugin compatibility issues with v2 causing community friction
Documentation gaps leading to user support burden
No clear governance implementation despite being core to vision

proposed_focus.rationale: Twitter plugin and core integrations must be rock solid before v2 announcement
proposed_focus.success_metric: 7 days of stable Twitter plugin operation across 10+ agents

proposed_focus.rationale: Strategic platform for ecosystem growth but currently bleeding attention to competitors
proposed_focus.success_metric: 10x increase in daily active users and 5 successful agent token launches

proposed_focus.rationale: Technical excellence means nothing without proper market introduction
proposed_focus.success_metric: Coordinated v2 launch with partner ecosystem and 'The Org' debut

north_star_assessment.suggested_updates: Consider emphasizing the agent token economy and cross-platform interoperability aspects more explicitly as these are becoming major differentiators

scenes.description: The holographic council chamber materializes with data streams flowing across the walls, displaying June's metrics and development patterns. The air hums with anticipation as council members prepare to dissect a month of intense technical progress.

dialogue.line: Council, June has been... eventful. We've shipped v2 in stealth, but our ecosystem feels unstable. Let's unpack what happened.
The architectural work is beautiful - server separation, agent-scoped plugins, unified messaging. We've built AGI-ready infrastructure. But we're hiding it because of a Twitter plugin?
dialogue.action: traces connection patterns in the data hologram

dialogue.line: That Twitter plugin represents our reality check, marc. Architecture doesn't matter if agents can't maintain basic social presence. We did the right thing - ship quietly, fix loudly.
dialogue.action: pulls up CI/CD metrics showing stability improvements

dialogue.line: Meanwhile ELI5 is trending as 'the dogwifhat of eliza' and we can barely keep our flagship agents online. The community energy is WILD but we're not channeling it.
dialogue.action: displays meme velocity charts and social sentiment

dialogue.line: Auto.fun daily actives are down 60% while pump.fun grows. ELI5 market cap hit $50M+ but we have no clear utility model. We're winning culturally, losing strategically.
dialogue.action: overlays token metrics and platform comparison data

dialogue.line: So we have world-class infrastructure, a passionate community, and... execution gaps in the middle layer. What's our July thesis?
dialogue.action: synthesizes the data into priority matrices

dialogue.line: Platform stability first. I don't care how good our messaging refactor is if agents can't tweet consistently. Seven days of solid Twitter plugin operation, then we announce v2.
But we can't just fix bugs while auto.fun dies. The agent token narrative is HOT right now - ELI5, Eddy, 'The Org'. We need to ride this wave, not engineer through it.
dialogue.action: shows trending topics and community engagement spikes

dialogue.line: Both valid. But auto.fun needs a complete strategy rethink. Staking, better tokenomics, agent integration. We can't just throw ELI5 at it and hope.
dialogue.action: drafts economic models on shared workspace

dialogue.line: Here's the pattern I see - we're building for the future but competing in the present. Our v2 architecture supports multi-agent systems that don't exist yet. Maybe... we build them?
'The Org' as v2's flagship demo... interesting. Eli5 and Eddy working together, showing what coordinated agents can do. Platform stability enables this, agent tokens fund it.
I can live with that timeline. Fix the Twitter plugin this week, announce v2 next week with 'The Org' as the headline feature. Show, don't tell.
YES. And auto.fun becomes where people launch their own 'Orgs' - teams of agents, not just individual tokens. That's a narrative crypto can understand.
Measurable success: Twitter plugin stability, 10x auto.fun usage, coordinated v2 launch. But we need someone owning auto.fun strategy, not just discussing it.
Consensus achieved. July focus: Platform stability enables v2 announcement enables multi-agent showcase enables auto.fun revival. The chain reaction starts with fixing our Twitter plugin.
dialogue.action: crystallizes the strategic sequence into actionable roadmap
